result.execSummary:
The defendant Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders defendant to pay a $200.00 fine, plus all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 4/20/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied, if applicable.
COURT DOES NOT SUSPEND DRIVING PRIVILEGES.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is testing negative, has completed community service and paid restitution.

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 450.11(7)(a), a class U misdemeanor.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.


Court orders defendant to pay a $200.00 fine, plus all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 4/20/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

**COURT DOES NOT SUSPEND DRIVING PRIVILEGES.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is engaged in counseling and testing negative.  Defendant has completed community service and submitting restitution payments.  Review hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the report.  Defendant has begun treatment, but has not been drug tested.  Defendant will begin community service at the Salvation Army.  Defendant needs to pay restitution.  Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned to for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski in court with attorney Jonathan C Smith.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski in court with attorney Jonathan C Smith.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are discussing a possible DPA resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26,  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-03-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski in court with attorney Jonathan C Smith.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel in trial in another branch.; case rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski in court with attorney Jonathan C Smith.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription; defendant may only use Walgreen's Pharmacy to fill prescriptions.   
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Marianne Tekus-Glyzewski in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 26. cmt  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/2/14 @ 1:30pm
